title: Ticket #6999: submit digest Cmd should not be full path for all Grid and VM jobs
description:
When submit_utils creates a submit digest, it currently promotes the executable to a full path. But this should only happen for types of jobs where this is actually an executable.

For VM universe, and for some types of Grid universe, the Executable keyword (Cmd job attribute) is really just a label for the job, and should not be treated as a filename. The code in submit_utils that sets SFR_PSEUDO_EXECUTABLE shows which types of jobs should not have the executable treated as a filename.
remarks:
2019-May-09 01:53:17 by bbockelm:
This tossed a compiler warning on Mac OS X; it looks like you used a string comparison when you meant to use assignment: 

--- a/src/condor_utils/submit_utils.cpp
+++ b/src/condor_utils/submit_utils.cpp
@@ -8051,7 +8051,7 @@ int SubmitHash::query_universe(MyString & sub_type, bool &is_docker)
        is_docker = IsDockerJob;
        if (JobUniverse != CONDOR_UNIVERSE_MIN) {
                if (JobUniverse == CONDOR_UNIVERSE_GRID) { sub_type = JobGridType; }
-               else if (JobUniverse == CONDOR_UNIVERSE_VM) { sub_type == VMType; }
+               else if (JobUniverse == CONDOR_UNIVERSE_VM) { sub_type = VMType; }
                return JobUniverse;
        }

Don't have the means to test this; pushed a fix but please re-review.

2019-May-09 14:12:44 by johnkn:
Thanks. It's a real bug, but moot at present because the sub_type field is only actually needed at present when the universe is grid.

2019-May-30 10:12:51 by johnkn:
no version history because only late materialization is affected.

This bug affected late materialization of VM universe, and some types of Grid universe jobs. ===VersionHistory:None=== (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
